Set in Vegas,this show follows the hopes,dreams and real life inside lives of 5 male escorts and their agent. Garrett-an ex-model and gigolo himself, set up the agency 'Cowboys for Angels' with the realisation that was there is a market for very attractive straight men (most of them are ex-models and you can see why) for the older and more sophisticated,busy single woman. They are all distinct characters,Brace, an older but still attractive man trying to find answers in spirituality. Nick - a somewhat arrogant would be rap artist Tom Cruise (but much better looking) lookalike,Steven,a real gorgeous cutie with a soft heart and a natural aptitude for understanding the needs of the fairer sex.jimmy,a totally off the charts,pulse racing hottie,with a twinkling smile and quick mind and Vin,the sexy newest recruit who wants to learn more about women. This show is worth watching just for the tottie,and believe me,by the end of the series even women who never would have considered seeing an escort will be pondering it,and checking available bank account funds.
Showtime have done a really good job of making a watchable and enjoyable docu drama. The banter of the escorts as they sit in the bar together mulling life,their jobs and their clients is often hilarious and at times,moving. This is mixed in with one on one head shot interviews with the men,and meetings/sex scenes with their clients,which vary from the normal,to highly unusual. A 'cock cage?'
If you're a woman you will love the sex scenes which are shown in a soft porn like atmosphere and focus on the men making sure their clients are satisfied with the emphasis on passion and female fulfilment more than anything else featuring normal sized,average females
All in all,a fascinating and thoroughly enjoyable masterpiece from Showcase
